symptoms.name: Chancre
symptoms.pattern: Single, painless ulcer at the site of infection

physical_findings: Indurated, painless ulcer (chancre) at extragenital site
risk_factors: Unprotected oral, anal, or vaginal sex

required: Clinical presentation consistent with primary syphilis (chancre)
Positive serological test for syphilis (e.g., VDRL, RPR, FTA-ABS, TPPA)

differential_diagnoses: Other ulcerative lesions (e.g., herpes simplex, chancroid, granuloma inguinale)
